subject: Technology
title: Steam: The Digital Storefront
description: A quick, practical guide to Steam: The Digital Storefront.

hook.text: In 2003, Valve launched Steam and gamers hated it. It required an internet connection to play offline games.

buildup.text: Steam started as a tool to update Valve's own games. Nobody wanted another launcher on their desktop.

discovery.text: Then Valve opened Steam to other developers. Suddenly thousands of games were available with one click.

twist.text: Steam sales offered games at 75% or more off. Players bought games they never intended to play, just because they were cheap.

climax.text: Steam now has over 130 million active users. It became the default way people buy and play PC games.

punchline.text: Everyone hated Steam at first. Now everyone uses it.

quiz.question: Why did gamers initially dislike Steam?
options: It required an internet connection and felt intrusive
